description: description[This example demonstrates a basic topology visualization.] tags[basic]

description[Force layout frees you from specifying node's coordinates explicitly. Instead, it spread them out automatically.] tags[layouts]
description[Special layout to represent the topology as a tree] tags[layouts,topomods]
tags[groups,basic] description[Adding groups is easy as pie. This example shows.]
description[A way to customize links' ends.] tags[topomods]
description[This example demonstrates a way to add labels to represent source and target interfaces of links.] tags[topomods]
description[Wanna draw a path over a topology? This example will show how.] tags[basic,path]
description[You can set a custom RGB color to any path.] tags[path]

description[Each link has a source and a destination. Sometimes this notation does not correspond to a path, that is the path's source could be the link's destination. If your path consists of a single link, you should specify the source node ("sourceNode" attribute) in path's configuration in order to display it in a correct way. In this example our path corresponds to link #2 (Houston -> New York), but we override it to make path be directed to Houston from New York.] tags[path,hacks]
description[In this example new elements are injected into a topology. The new elements are status icons, that visualize each node's state.] tags[basic,topomods]
description[If you need to trail the links with arrow heads, that's how] tags[topomods,hacks]
